clinical_study.brief_title: Breastfeeding Education Support Tool for Baby
clinical_study.official_title: Breastfeeding Education Support Tool for Baby

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare data associated with breastfeeding experiences and outcomes--specifically, breastfeeding continuation after initiation, exclusivity for 6 months of an infant's life, and breastfeeding duration--among 120 subjects recruited late in pregnancy and provided peer counseling and education services incorporating mobile health (mHealth) tools during a period of at least 6 months post-delivery with the data collected from a control group of approximately 120 mothers that did not receive the study intervention.

detailed_description.textblock: Approximately 24 women that are experienced in breastfeeding will be recruited to serve in the role of breastfeeding peer counselors. These women will assess usability and acceptability of mobile health (mHealth) education tools designed following a series of focus groups for the project, Breastfeeding Education Support Tool for Baby. The mHealth tools will be used during the training and education of the peer counselor subjects. Following appropriate modification, some of the mHealth tools will be used with a total of approximately 120 women recruited late in pregnancy for initial breastfeeding counseling before delivery and the subsequent provision, for at least 6 months post-delivery, of home visits for peer counseling and education that integrates use of mHealth tools. Peer counselors and research staff will gather data from mothers receiving the intervention about breastfeeding experiences and outcomes, including breastfeeding continuation after initiation, exclusivity for 6 months of an infant's life, and breastfeeding duration. This data will be compared to data obtained through surveys administered to a control group of approximately 120 maternal subjects that received standard pre- and post-delivery care but not the study intervention of peer counseling and education using mHealth tools.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Intervention group having peer counseling and education and a comparative (control) group having standard of care

primary_outcome.time_frame: Ideally within an hour following a normal delivery
primary_outcome.description: Maternal subjects' compliance with the recommendation to initiate breastfeeding soon after delivery

primary_outcome.measure: Exclusivity of breastfeeding during the first 6 months following an infant's birth
primary_outcome.time_frame: First 6 months following an infant's birth
primary_outcome.description: Maternal subjects' compliance with the recommendation to provide only breast milk

primary_outcome.measure: Breastfeeding continuation (along with supplemental feeding) after an infant reaches 6 months of age
primary_outcome.time_frame: As the study is time-limited, assessment will occur 6-9 months following an infant's birth
primary_outcome.description: Maternal subjects' compliance with the recommendation for continued breastfeeding along with supplemental feeding after an infant reaches 6 months of age

secondary_outcome.measure: Usability of the mHealth tools for the education of the peer counselors and the support of peer counseling and education services provided to mothers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During peer counseling education/training (project months 8-9) and during study (months 9-21)
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal subjects will utilize a scale to rate the usability of the mHealth tools and they will have the opportunity to develop recommendations relative to tool improvement

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of peer counseling and education services and mHealth tools (the intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal subjects will utilize a scale to rate the acceptability of these services and mHealth tools that constitute the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with the peer counseling and education services and mHealth tools
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal subjects will utilize a scale to indicate satisfaction level associated with the intervention

arm_group.description: Breastfeeding counseling and education services using mHealth tools
No intervention, only standard of care

intervention.description: Breastfeeding counseling and education by educated and trained peer counselors using mHealth tools

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Intervention Subjects: 1) Peer counselors--personal experience with breastfeeding and living in a intervention cluster; and 2) Pregnant women-mothers willing to consent to assignment to a breastfeeding peer counselor and planning to reside in an intervention area for a minimum of 6 months post-delivery, Controls Subjects: Similar pregnant women-mothers that live in a non-intervention area and receive standard of care who are willing to participate in a survey enabling collection of data for comparative purposes
Exclusion Criteria: Pregnant women-mothers determining before delivery that they would not initiate breastfeeding; pregnant women planning to reside after delivery outside of the areas selected for the intervention or the areas selected for recruitment of controls

eligibility.gender_description: Females as study involves an activity only females can perform and only females could be considered peers of mothers

overall_official.affiliation: Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, KLE Academy of Higher Education

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified participant data for the primary and secondary outcomes are expected to be shared in publications resulting from this pilot study.
